qstack.regression.kernel module¶

qstack.regression.kernel.kernel(X, Y=[], sigma=32.0, akernel='L', gkernel=None, gdict={'alpha': 1.0, 'normalize': 1})¶

Computes a kernel using a list of representations.

Parameters:

  • X (list of arrays) – Representations.

  • Y (list of arrays) – Property???. Defaults to [].

  • () (gdict) – Sigma hyperparameter. Defaults to 32.0.

  • () – Kernel type (G for Gaussian, L for Laplacian, and myL for Laplacian for open-shell systems). Defaults to L

  • () – Global kernel type (agv for average, rem for REMatch kernel, None for local kernels). Defaults to None.

  • () – Dictionary like input string to initialize global kernel parameters. Defaults to {‘alpha’:1.0, ‘normalize’:1}.

Returns:

A numpy ndarray containing the kernel.

qstack.regression.kernel.main()¶
